greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = prime(12), for n >= 2, a(n) is the smallest prime not previously used which contains a digit from a(n-1).
comment: a(n) = prime(n) for almost all n. Probably a(n) = prime(n) for all n > N for some N, but N must be very large. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 20 2011
formula: a(n) ~ n log n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 20 2011
program: lista(nn) = {my(v=[37]); for(n=2, nn, forprime(p=2, default(primelimit), if(!in(v,p)&&common(v[#v],p), v=concat(v,p); break))); v; }
results.author: _Zak Seidov_ and _Eric Angelini_, May 24 2005
